Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou, who was arrested Dec. 1 as she changed planes in Canada, was accused of hiding ties between Huawei and a company called Skycom that did business in Iran, a lawyer representing Canada said during the court hearing. content.desc: BEIJING — As Huawei’s finance chief and daughter of its founder, Meng Wanzhou has been a polished, professional face for a huge technology firm that long was opaque to the outside world. content.desc: Huawei’s finance chief is set to appear at a bail hearing in Vancouver on Friday amid a backlash in Chinese media over her detention. Chief financial officer Meng Wanzhou, daughter of Huawei founder Ren Zhengfei, was arrested by Canadian authorities on Saturday at the request of the US government which is seeking extradition. No official reason has been given but it is thought to be linked to alleged violations of US sanctions on Iran. content.title: China's Huawei appoints chairman as acting CFO after executive's arrest - Reuters
content.desc: China's Huawei Technologies has appointed Chairman Liang Hua as acting chief financial officer (CFO) following the arrest in Canada of its CFO, who faces extradition to the United States, staff briefed on an internal memo told Reuters. Huawei did not immediately respond to a request for comment. CFO Meng Wanzhou, who is also the daughter of Huawei founder Ren Zhengfei, was detained in Canada on Saturday at the request of U.S. authorities. (Reporting By Sijia Jiang in HONG KONG and Yilei Sun in BEIJING; Editing by Anne Marie Roantree and Kim Coghill)
